results.title: Clay in a special way
results.creator_credit: Larry Schultz, Bill Snider and Oak Creek Films
results.brief_description: The film examines the positive, creative process of an art project with 4th, 5th and 6th grade students, handicapped and non-handicapped. An honest instructor expresses his initial doubts about teaching a “mainstreamed” class. Deaf and blind students participate with the aid of sign language interpreters and sighted students’ oral descriptions. Students are given information on the historical usage of clay through slides and a trip to a local museum. An artist, Maynard Fishler, visits the classroom to discuss his work. Throughout the project, a multi-sensory approach is used. The students decide to interpret transportation with clay, each student developing his own personal communication. The clay sculptures are the visual, concrete expression of a successful learning experience for all. Communication and creativity on may levels are results no less important.

results.title: Classic rock: the ultimate anthology
results.brief_description: This disc contains fourteen classic rock anthems from an array of British musicians, performed live. The tracks are: Wishbone Ash “Blowin’ free”; Argent “Hold your head up”; The Sensational Alex Harvey band “Delilah”; Uriah Heep “Return to fantasy”; Asia “Heat of the moment”; Focus “Sylvia”; Emerson, Lake & Palmer “The Barbarian”; Family “Strange band”; Curved air “Melinda more or less”; Slade “Get down and get with it”; Deep Purple “Child in time”; Free “I’ll be moving”; Thin Lizzy “The Sun goes down”; Barclay James Harvest “Mockingbird”.

results.title: Cinema of vengeance
results.creator_credit: Robyn Russell, George Tan and Vengeance Productions
results.brief_description: A documentary on the history of Martial Arts in film, covering fifty years of Chinese action cinema from the late forties through to present day hi-tech action drama. “Cinema of Vengeance” features profiles of Jackie Chan, Jimmy Wang Yu, Bruce Li, Chow Yun-Fat, Gary Daniels, Samo Hung, Ti Lung, John Woo, Cynthia Rothrock, Don Wilson, Steve James, Mike Kelly and Joe Lewis. It also includes previously unseen footage and an exclusive interview with Bruce Lee.

results.title: Choices
results.brief_description: Shrinkage is the unaccountable disappearance of merchandise and can cost companies large amounts of money. “Shrinkage” may be due to external theft, administrative errors and internal theft. This program looks at the last of these three, through the experiences of two newly recruited shop assistants, and how they react to pressure to bend or break the rules. The program proposes four solutions to “shrinkage”. Be conscientious in every procedure, know the rules and follow them, don’t get involved with others’ weaknesses, although you should report suspicious behaviour and lastly avoid temptation yourself.

results.title: Chinese legends, gods and prophets
results.creator_credit: Sumner J. Glimcher and Mass Communications
results.brief_description: An introduction to oriental myth, religion and philosophy from the Shang Dynasty, 1766-l122 BC, to rites connected with ancestor worship as practised today in Taiwan.

results.title: China: changes from within (TEFC)
results.brief_description: Focuses on the manifestations of social economic and political changes that are taking place in China. These changes will take place over a long time, however the atmosphere which has allowed them is evidence of a trend towards a more ‘democratic socialism’.

results.title: China. Part 3. Life in the city
results.brief_description: Shows daily life in Peking, including scenes of schooling, shopping, religious ceremonies, and construction of new blocks of flats and a causeway. Describes the emphasis placed on health and fitness. Edited version of “China!”.

results.title: China. Part 2. Life in the country
results.brief_description: Reveals China as a land of contrasts. Shows sheep herding in the Sunkiang province, terraced hillsides planted with rice in the more temperate areas, inland lakes and rivers which provide fish, life in country towns, and harvesting activities. Edited from “China!”.

results.title: Children of the street
results.creator_credit: Francois Fioquet and Via le Monde
results.brief_description: Looks at lives of two newspaper boys in Caracas, Venezuela, who work up to nine hours a day to make a living on the streets of a tough city, and to earn money for an education. Useful as a comparison with a lifestyle very different to that experienced by most Australian children.

results.title: Children of the Peloponnese
results.creator_credit: Daniel Bertolino and Via le Monde
results.brief_description: Depicts the life style of families in the central Peloponnese region on Greece concentrating on the children. Shows the long, arduous walk they must take each day to go to school in another village, schooling, aspects of culture and sex roles.
